Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: bungeeflyer
Reviews.Content: A friend and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. After reading some of the reviews I was not expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. Our room was in the building next door to the main reception and was accessed on a buzzer system. Our room was at the top of the building (51 steps, and after a full day walking around I felt every one them) and was facing onto the rear, so despite its proximity to the railway we were not overly bothered with noise. The room was quite spacious and although very basically furnished was spotlessly clean and the beds were comfortable. The toilet/wet room was a little on the small side but again adequate with good sized towels provided, although the waste under our sink could do with fixing as it leaked. They could also do with a mirror in the bedroom as there is only one small one in the bathroom.There was a t.v but as there is only Italian programs on was of no interest to us. The continental breakfast provided was good with a choice of cereals, bread (toaster provided) jams and croissantes with good coffee, tea (bags) and fruit juices. All in all, for the price, a good 2* with friendly staff and well placed, being only a 15 minute straight walk from Termini. I would certainly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who just wants a clean basic room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krzysztof G
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site I didn't expect much from this hotel however, on arrival we soon realised the bad reviews were most definitely incorrect. We had a room on the second floor overlooking the road so it was noisy if the window was open but that can only be expected in a city location. However, with the window shut the noise was almost non existent. As the breakfast finished at 9.30am we didn't get up in time to experience it. Overall this was a great hotel and I will use it again on my next visit to Rome and will also recommend to others visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: luvrui
Reviews.Content: On arriving the grounds, the orangy interior gave a really comforting ambient. The key handled to be opens up the single ensuite room on the second floor. Room was all in all very cosy with the orangy and yellow bed fittings. Window overlooks the greenhouse like breakfast area. Unfortunately, there was extremely weak wifi connection in room, I had to constantly sit at the lobby and the breakfast area downstairs, and it was extremely cold than. Breakfast was continental, crossiants, toast and a wide variety of preserves, and not forgetting espressos which will be served upon request. Despite it was merely 600metres away just straight down the left road of the termini, I had difficulty locating it. I must say I am a pretty good navigator, but my overall bad rome experience had impaired my navigation intinct. New Year day, a "police" whom drove passed me while I was heading back just merely less than 100 metres away from the hotel door. This "Police" flashed his badge and kept it almost immediately, demanded for my passport. As in doubt, I requested to see his "Police" badge again and he pull over his vehicle in the middle of the lane and got down. He started going through all my belongings as I refused to let go of my passport. The thing which made me real in doubt, this "Police man" started to sniff my wallet and my bag, took out my debit card, cash, accusing me that I am a Japanese and if I have cigarettes on me. His weird actions made me puzzled, just as he was holding on to my belongings, out of now where my courage started overcoming my fear. I snatched my things back from him and shouted "YOU ARE TRYING TO RUN AWAY WITH MY THINGS RIGHT!" The conjested traffic which was caused by his pull over vehicle started honking. He jetted off. I returned to Hotel Midi, told the guy who was tending the reception about what happened and understand that this "Policeman" is probably an imposter. First, Police should be driving a police car and not a private car. Secondly, Police always travel in pair. At last, this Policeman whom I met is not an italian. Lesson learnt after this encounter, never hand over anyone your belongings, offer to WALK to the nearest police station if this happens to me again. Nevertheless, I must thank the Reception guy whom had cleared my doubts, in order for me have a piece of mind for the rest of my remaining journey.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Raz86
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of negative reviews of this hotel, I was a bit apprehensive about my trip to Rome. It was my first time there and I wanted everything to be perfect! We arrived at the hotel at night and the surrounding area looked dirty, unfriendly and a little intimidating. However, I was very pleasantly surprised by the Midi Hotel. We were buzzed in at the door which made us feel very safe, and upon entering we were delighted to see a very clean and open reception area with a staff member who spoke perfect English. Our room was on the first floor, overlooking the conservatory for breakfast, and the garden. We had a balcony, which was great for sitting out after a long day of walking, and also very handy as my partner smokes (ash trays are provided). Our room was small and compact, but very cosy and comfortable, however the bathroom was tiny and the toilet was awkwardly placed and hard to use. There is a bedet, in the centre of the room and the toilet is between the shower and a wall and is very cramped. We are both tall so it was a little awkward, but this is only a minor issue. The shower was small, with a fixed shower head and a detachable one, and the water pressure was great. The corner of our shower had a leak, so afterwards we put a towel down to dry up the water, which wasn't much. We didn't use the TV or mini bar, we really just wanted a place to sleep. The bed was very comfortable, and there wasn't much noise at the back of the hotel, so if you don't like noise I would recommend asking for a room at the back. The room had shutter and glass doors that lead onto the balcony, and it was nice to leave the shutters open as it was quite warm at night (even in March). The breakfast was pretty basic, bread that you had the option to make toast with, pre packed croissants, cereal and juice. We only ate breakfast one day of the four we stayed, not because we didn't like it but because we were either out quite early or we slept in a bit. The location of the hotel is great, close enough to the Termini station and within walking distance to many sights. We got Roma Passes on our first day and would recommend them for free entrance to two museums or archeological sites,and free travel on all metro, bus and tram routes (they cost €25 and are valid for three days). We used the metro a lot and it was very easy to find our way around. There is a great restaurant, a street away on Via Manzoni called RED, and we ate there every night. The food is seriously nice, and very reasonably priced, and the staff are very welcoming and friendly and speak English as well as Italian. They really love to hear a few words in Italian, as do most other Italians. They seem to make more of an effort to help you if you make an attempt to use their language. Overall, the Midi Hotel was a fantastic base for us over the four days we spent in Rome. The location and price were perfect, as well as helpful staff, some of whom went that extra mile to help us. I had an excellent time in Rome and I can't wait to go back already. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is lovely, really!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashleybradley
Reviews.Content: Having read all the bad comments regarding this hotel before I travelled, I wasn't looking forward to going there. However, I found this hotel ideal for me. The rooms were clean, en suite and air conditioned. There was no lift but I was on the first floor anyway so wasn't an issue. One member of staff was very helpful, polite and personal, always remembering me and my room number. Breakfast was simple: cereal and toast, but with all that pasta and pizza to be had later it was enough for me and again, not bad at all. The only quibble was the location. The trams outside didn't seem to go to the city centre so had to walk to Termini for the metro but again, not a tremendous issue. One thing to remember when reading reviews, people are different and expectations are different. Since all I wanted was somewhere to crash at night, I found it more than adequate. Had I expected anything more, then maybe not but I was pleased with it, very pleased with all aspects. The hotel is highly recommended and would consider going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: TobiSoenderborg
Reviews.Content: When you look at the pictures it seems ok, but think a second time before you book this hotel. Or I would more call it a hostel. OK you have your own room with bathroom, but that is it. The rooms are dirty and there is much noise from trains and traffic on the road. They have an ok little garden where you sit and eat your breakfast, but the breakfast is worth nothing. You get some dry toast what you have to make yourself, some very cheep cheese without any taste and the worst ham I have ever tried. The money you pay for this is not worth it. We travel alot and have seen some different quality hotels, but this is so far the worst we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Rome is fab and so is this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Holidaygirl7779
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. We arrived at 1am we were greeted by the recepionist who was very helpful and friendly. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable, brand new bathroom, tv and modern bedroom. Very close to all the main attractions by foot, or next to Termini if you prefer to travel by train or catch tour buses. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: millieko
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we were a bit apprehensive about what to expect, admittingly the walk from the termini is a bit off-putting, but dont let that put you off. We found the hotel clean and the staff accomodating, breakfast...what do people expect your in Italy. We were recommended a traditional Italian restraunt by the staff called `Da Pino alla piazzetta` which we recommend you try. However we would like to warn fellow travellers of a restraunt called `Padellaccioz` in Viale Manzoni, beware we were ripped off here. Overall Rome was amazing, it was everything we expected and more....

Reviews.Title: “Small & compact!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacqui22
Reviews.Content: Once we had negoticated the Tramps & Drunks & illegal imigrants & rivers of urine and piles of Poo (not just dogs!!) we arrived at the Midi Hotel. It was like a beacon of hope in a very unfriendly & intimatimidating area. We were welcomed rather coldly and We were they taken back out on the street to an adjoining building. The room was VERY clean and modern but if I was into swinging cats I would be out of luck, I would have had trouble swinging a small Hamster! The walls were paper thin, so to the young female pilgrim staying next door I would say a little less porno on TV and more confession wouldnt go a miss!. Also a badly positioned emergency cord in the shower made sure we were woken every morning before our alarm, as it would not be turned off until you contacted reception, which was hard as the rooms had no phones!, so the point of pulling the cord in an emergency and someone comes to your rescue was a lie.We were greeted in the morning by a unfriendly cook ( I use the term loosely!) and waitress who pointed to a small table that was sparsly ladened with food! Breakfast consisted of wafer thin ham & cheese, bits of cake in packets, baby slices of bread which if you had plenty of time you could toast yourself, cornflakes, both golden & brown?! and Museli (which a rabbit would find hard to stomach! and yougurt, all bought from the nearest discount supermarket. If you decide to stay at the Midi Hotel I would have room only and pop to Macdonald for breakfast(a 10min walk).

Reviews.Title: “hell hole”
Reviews.Author: globetrekkers_8
Reviews.Content: the staff are very unfriendly,the breakfast is nt really a breakfast more like lunch ie cheese and ham.it certainly aint 3 star less thn one star. diregarded needles at the entrance of this hotel beggers camp across from the place,in fact i wouldnt put a animal in there to stay .dogs dirt all along the path to the door broken bottles aswel with used condoms around to.DO NOT GO NEAR THIS HOTEL ....FAULTY TOWERS AINT GOT A LOOK IN

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money lovley friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireVictoria
Reviews.Content: we stayed at hotel midi, well atually the adjoining hotel giolitti, next door, but you have to check in and have breakfast at the hotel midi, the staff were very helpful and friendly and made are stay very welcome, dont let the hotel put you off when you first see it , as we did, but when we got to are room it was beautiful, everything was new, and very clean, a lovley bathroom with a power shower, hair dryer mirror, etc, the beds were very comfy, with a mini bar (very good) that was always fully stocked every day, and a flat screen telly on are wall, and a balcony over looking gardens with shutters that let a lovely breeze in ,we didnt expect this for a two star hotel, it was great definately value for money,the noise in rome is loud at night and it is where ever you stay in rome, so after many years of going there the best trick is to take boots travel ear plugs you will never hear a thing breakfast was next door and it had every thing you would want for breakfast to set you up for the day a head, all different friut juices,different jams for toast, cereal, yogurts, italian goodies, friut, ham and cheese, with lovely bread. all help your self as much as you want. location is central but a fair walk to all the attractions, but there are lots of taxis , and the station is very close buy, so we didnt find it a problem, half the fun is walking round discovering things. so all in all it was a very nice stay, and i would definately recomend it,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect bargain break”
Reviews.Author: LondonJessiecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the midi hotel and found it suited our needs perfectly. Not wanting to spend a fortune on accomodation we found the hotel clean, friendly and very secure. We had a room at the back which overlooked the gardens and was very pretty. The room was basic and bijoux but clean and well maintained. The air conditioning wasn't working but in february that wasn't a problem for us - although in the summer it would be a different story. Breakfast is worth skipping but at these room prices were not even expecting breakfast! Tips! The local, family run restaurant Taverna Anna (Something like that) which is very close by is definitely worth a visit. Other than that though the area is rather lacking bars /restaurants but close enough to the Termini & Metro to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rome weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: LondonBeaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September for b/f birthday. After reading reviews on here, did not know what to expect but was very pleasantly surprised! The check in was easy. Room was great if a bit little but how much room do you need? Great shower, lovely staff. We did not ever wake up early enough for the brekkie but it looked substantial - cereals, toast, juice, coffee etc. The location was fine - need to take a bus or metro into the centre of Rome(good thing about being near to Termini was that buses ran thru the night so no need to pay for cabs late into the night) but the journeys were only about 20 mins max so no hardship whatsoever. Cab to and from airport was €60 each way - you can organise a coach shuttle from nr the termini for about €9 but we had a fairly early flight home and a cab was easier. Venture into Trastavere for great food / drinks. Do take the walking tours of the Colosseo and ancient forums.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the midi”
Reviews.Author: melmoth
Reviews.Content: I booked a single at the Midi Hotel through Lastminute, at €50/night, and I have to say it was a very decent accomodation and extremely good value too. The room on the first floor looking the nice roman patio value was clean, and the attention of reception was correct. The breakfast was nice too although the coffee was instant. On the possible negative sides: - a previous review stated that they had an issue with water leaking from the last floor that they are building on top of the building. Well they don't seem to have completed the works, so that might be a cause of trouble - to enter the hotel you need to ring a bell and the receptionist will open the door from their desk. On my first night a guest was ringing that bell at least for half an hour before someone appeared. - the reception staff changed many times throughout my stay, at least four or five different people attended me during my three night stay, which seems far too many for a 10 room hotel. - the hotel next door "Hotel Center" seems to share the reception with the Midi, in fact their customers plus other Hotel's customers on the other side of the patio had breakfast at the Midi, all comunicatiing through the Patio. Although it didn't mean anything wrong to me, I think It poses some security issues.

Reviews.Title: “A bit surprised”
Reviews.Author: Seifriki
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this side and was surprised when I went to the Midi Hotel. From the outside it looked a bit shabby but inside it's beautiful. The whole place is redecorated. The rooms are no very big but they got the cleanest bath rooms I've ever seen in a hotel. Well, the breakfast (like everywhere in Italy) is not a real breakfast. I can say I liked staying at the Midi Hotel also because its good place near the station.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider it...............”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do you start........ 1) Nice hotel, very modern inside and lovely looking room. 2) However, you must like constant tram noise, and building work on the roof which starts at 8am ! 3) The added bonus was a flooded bathroom because they failed to cover the open roof, which blew all the electrics within the room and left an inch of water on the carpet/bathroom floor ! 4) Finally, unhelpful staff who make you stay in the flooded room, with no electricity, except for a tiny torch for comfort ! And then they fail to reimburse you for the night of hell, only paying up when our travel agent put pressure on them. This hotel ruined our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Midi Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great little centrally located hotel. It is small, friendly and absolutely spotless clean. The rooms are all newly refurbished with air conditioning and a great power shower in the bathroom, comfy beds and minibar. I had a little balcony overlooking the patio terrace. As a single female spending 5 days in Rome I felt totally safe and at ease. It looks a bit dodgy from the outside but once you enter it is a real haven. It is about 10-15 mins walk from the Termini train station and centrally located for all the main sights. It's about 15 mins walk to the Colliseum and Forum. There are a couple of really great restaurants around the corner, with excellent delicious food and really cheap. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it if you are looking for a reasonably priced (cheap!), centrally located, and clean hotel in the centre of Rome. The added bonus is that from Rome FCO airport you pay €9.50 to Termini station and the hotel is just a short walk from it. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from staying at the midi hotel, outside you don't get a very good impression, as it looks a bit down town. Inside it looked very pleasant and nicely decorated, we was warmly greeted by the staff who showed us to our room, which was very clean, and new looking the bathroom was a good size. We found on our first day the air conditioning wasn't working, but was fixed the day after. The only problem with the hotel was that it was noisey, from trams and traffic, the breakfast was basic, and it took 10 minutes to make toast as the toaster only did one side at a time, and on leaving the hotel we got a bill for the bar that was in our room, which we didn't use. Apart from that the hotel was value for money and wasn't too far away from some sites and metro, and providing you don't mind the noise, it is a pleasant little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY! FROM THIS PLACE !! As with the other reviewer of this hotel, we were also transferred to this hotel after booking a room at the Hotel Tempi di Pallade. This was the first inconvenience. When we arrived at the Hotel Midi, we had to wait for 45 minutes for them to get our room ready (mind you it was after the 1:00 check in time). Finally when our room was ready, we had to again walk outside about a block to get to our room. When we arrived we have to go down a flight of stairs - yes down to the basement - to our apartment like hotel room. I will try to paint you the picture of what we walked into but it will not do it justice to just how horrible it was. There were two mini friges - neither worked. A small tv, A tiny dirty bathroom with no shower just a wand hanging on the wall (we felt dirtier after showering in it) dirty paint chipped walls. A small kitchen with open containers of food in the cupboards (as if someone was living there) and the worst part was a random door in the corner which connects the the adjoining room. When we opened it we saw a two way mirror. When we looked through it (yes, you could see through it) we could see someone lying on their bed next door. A bit freaky if you ask me. The breakfast was horrible in comparison to all other places we stayed and the staff was downright rude to us. The neighborhood was frightening as night and downright slummy during the day. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone unless you have a death wish. STAY AWAY!!!
